I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

c: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
lc: X -> nat
Hc: forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x
i: nat
ll: list X
j: nat

Goal:
map fst (link i ll j) = list_an i (length ll)

Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
list_fun_inv : forall (X : Type) (l : list X), X -> {f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
link_app : forall (i : nat) (ll mm : list X) (j : nat), link i (ll ++ mm) j = link i ll j ++ link (length ll + i) mm (lsum ll + j)
list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m : list nat) (y : nat) (r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ x :: m ++ y :: r -> a <= x /\ x < y < a + n
Permutation.nat_bijection_Permutation : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> FinFun.Injective f -> let l := seq 0 n in map f l ~p l
map_list_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (x : X) (n : nat), map f (list_repeat x n) = list_repeat (f x) n
flat_map_single : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (l : list X), flat_map (fun x : X => f x :: nil) l = map f l
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}}
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
nth_nth_nth_map : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A) (ln : list nat) (dn : nat), n < length ln \/ length l <= dn -> nth (nth n ln dn) l d = nth n (map (fun x : nat => nth x l d) ln) d
firstn_all2 : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A), length l <= n -> firstn n l = l
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
firstn_removelast : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A), n < length l -> firstn n (removelast l) = firstn n l

``` 
assert (H1: length (link i ll j) = length ll).
{ induction ll.
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. rewrite Hc. rewrite IHll. reflexivity. }
assert (H2: forall a b, map fst (a :: b) = fst a :: map fst b).
{ intros. reflexivity. }
rewrite (list_pick ll j H1). rewrite (map_ext_Forall (fun x : (nat * nat) => fst x) (fun x => fst x) (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1)))))) by (apply Forall_forall_map; intros).
rewrite link_app. rewrite (IHll i j). simpl. rewrite Hc. rewrite list_pick.
- reflexivity.
- lia.
- reflexivity. auto.
- rewrite (firstn_all2 j (map fst (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1))))))). 
  rewrite <- (map_firstn (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1))))) j).
  rewrite <- firstn_map. reflexivity.
- apply firstn_removelast. exact H1.
Qed. 
```

original: assert (H1: length (link i ll j) = length ll). { induction ll. - simpl. reflexivity. - simpl. rewrite Hc. rewrite IHll. reflexivity. } assert (H2: forall a b, map fst (a :: b) = fst a :: map fst b). { intros. reflexivity. } rewrite (list_pick ll j H1). rewrite (map_ext_Forall (fun x : (nat * nat) => fst x) (fun x => fst x) (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1)))))) by (apply Forall_forall_map; intros). rewrite link_app. rewrite (IHll i j). simpl. rewrite Hc. rewrite list_pick. - reflexivity. - lia. - reflexivity. auto. - rewrite (firstn_all2 j (map fst (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1))))))). rewrite <- (map_firstn (link i (removelast ll) (lc (fst (projT1 (list_pick ll j H1))))) j). rewrite <- firstn_map. reflexivity. - apply firstn_removelast. apply H1.
